metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3693 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branchprediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attackerwith local user access via a speculative buffer overflow and side-channelanalysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-111-generic - 4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-111-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-111-lowlatency - 4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-111-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-111-generic - 4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1011-aws - 4.4.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

intel-microcode - 3.20180312.0~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
